message.content: Implement the following plan: # Landing Page Pricing Update ## Context Current pricing page uses **messages** as primary metric. New billing model is **1 credit = 1 context created**. Need to rewrite the `plans` array to reflect new model. ## File `website/components/pricing-section.tsx` — lines 22-48 (the `plans` const) ## Changes Replace the `plans` array with: **Free:** - `100 contexts/month` - `Unlimited messages per context` - `Unlimited reads` - `7-day version history` - `Community support` **Pro ($29/mo):** - `5,000 contexts/month` - `Unlimited messages per context` - `Unlimited reads` - `90-day version history` - `Then $0.01 per extra context` **Enterprise (Custom):** - `Unlimited contexts` - `Custom retention` - `Dedicated support` - `SLA + SSO` - `Custom rate limits` **Footer** — keep as-is. ## Verification - `cd website && bun dev` → check `/` or `/#pricing` visually If you need specific details from before exiting plan mode (like exact code snippets, error messages, or content you generated), read the full transcript at: /Users/fabioroma/.claude/projects/-Users-fabioroma-Code-firecrawl/6c05b8fe-70bd-4cd4-b93d-62e21f5bd7bf.jsonl
Because ultracontext is in the parent folder

no, do it inside the website folder

you already did the guidelines. reread the convo

Yeah, a context is a container of messages

Search past conversations with claude All the way down recursively on Code folder to see if there is any convo discussing pricing and usage. I guess there is. I remember pasting results of sql queries I ran on supabase
